commitResults.messageBody:
The codebase contains Duke as a template placeholder.

The name of the chatbot needs to be personalized for our chatbot.

Let's,
* Remove all Duke references from the source code.
* Rename chatbot to Botling.
* Implement basic greeting and exit functionality.

Level-0 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Botling currently greets and exits.

Echo functionality serves as a foundation for basic user interaction.

The name of the chatbot needs to be personalized for our chatbot.

Let's,
* Echo commands from user input.
* Exit when "bye" is given as an input.

Level-1 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Botling currently echoes commands.

List functionality serves as a foundation for tracking tasks.

Let's,
* Store all inputs by the user except for "list" and "bye".
* Display all inputs by the user when "list" is given as an input.

Level-2 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Botling currently lists tasks.

Creating a class for tasks follows in accordance with OOP.
Allows for abstraction and better structure.

Let's,
* Create a Task class with two attributes - name and isDone.
* Each Task object is responsible for their own statuses (isDone).

Level-3 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Botling currently has a new Task class.

This allows for tasks to be marked as done depending on their status.

Let's,
* Update Botling's main method to incorporate the mark as done features.

Level-3 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Task class currently has two constructors.

Reconfiguring the first constructor to utilize the second constructor.
The first constructor is a more specific version of the second.

Let's,
* Update Task class first constructor to use the second constructor.

Level-3 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently only Task class exists.

Different subtypes of Tasks have different outputs.

Let's,
* Create a ToDo class that extends Task class.

Level-4 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently only Task and ToDo class exists.

Different subtypes of Tasks have different outputs.

Let's,
* Create a Deadlines class that extends Task class.

Level-4 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently only Task, ToDo and Deadlines class exists.

Different subtypes of Tasks have different outputs.

Let's,
* Create a Events class that extends Task class.

Level-4 functionality implemented according to requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ToDos, Deadlines and Events functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently Task, ToDo Deadlines and Events class exists.

They have not been implemented into Botling yet.

Let's,
* Implement the functionality of the various classes in Botling main().

Level-4 functionality implemented according to requirements.
Level-5 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently test cases are manually run.

Manual testing is prone to human errors and is time consuming.

Let's,
* Create a rigorous set of test cases for all current functionality.

Level-5 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently all constants are defined under Botling.java.

There is a long list of constants that should be defined under Enum.

Let's,
* Create a MsgConstants Enum class for String constants.
* Create a ValConstants Enum class for int constants.

Level-5 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently all tasks are stored in an ArrayList under Botling.java

This does not provide task specific functionalities eg. marking a task.

Let's,
* Create a TaskList class which wraps the ArrayList<Task>.
* Add further functionality such as mark(), unmark().
* Print messages where applicable.

Level-5 functionality implemented according to requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Redirect Print from Task.java and TaskList.java to Botling.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently print statements are created on demand when needed.

This does not adhere to OOP principles.
Botling should be handling expected messages.

Lets,
* Switch all method outputs to String where applicable.

Level-5 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently exceptions are all handled under if else control blocks.

Unexpected inputs should be handled by exceptions.

Lets,
* Create an InvalidInputException class.
* Create respective methods that would print handled errors.

Level-5 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently all commands are handled by Botling.java.

A separate class should be created to isolate the parsing of commands.

Lets,
* Create a CommandParser.java class that parses all user inputs.
* Allow the CommandParser to handle all exceptions.
* Return all correct messages to Botling.java.

Level-5 functionality implemented according to requirements.

Currently Botling.java is outdated with the other classes.

Lets,
* Update the code for Botling.java to utilize all created functionality.

Level-5 functionality implemented according to requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update input.txt and EXPECTED.txt for Delete Task Functionality
Updated MsgConstants.java and ValConstants.java for Delete Functionality
Add Delete Task Functionality to TaskList.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently TaskList can only add tasks.

Removing completed tasks should be natural for a tasks list.

Lets,
* Add a remove() method for TaskList class.

Level-6 functionality implemented according to requirements.
Level-6 functionality implemented according to requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor MsgConstants into MsgGenConst and CmdConst
commitResults.messageBody:
Current MsgConstants contains all String constants.

However, different class uses different parts of the constants.
Constants should be unique to the specific class.

Lets,
* Refactor MsgConstants into MsgGenConst and CmdConst.
* MsgGenConst will be for messages produced by Botling.
* CmdConst will be for commands, as well as their expected syntax.

Currently messages are printed immediately when required.

This goes against OOP practice.

Lets,
* Create a MsgGen class to generate all messages required.

Currently all code in the various classes are outdated.

Lets,
* Refactor all code to utilize the new MsgGen class.
* Ensure that all messages are generated by MsgGen.
* Only Botling.java should have print functionality.

Currently there is no functionality for restoring previous tasks.

Creating a file to read and write tasks allows for stored progress.

Lets,
* Create a history.txt file to store progress for the user locally.

Level-7 functionality implemented according to requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Read and Write Capabilities for Tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently TaskListWriter has been implemented.
However it is not being used by other classes.

Lets,
* Create a write version of the tasks for TaskListWriter to store.
* Ensure the write version is readable and recoverable.

Level-7 functionality implemented according to requirements.
